result.execSummary:
The defendant Carlo P Quesada was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 4:00pm on OCTOBER 10TH, 2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.

Pay fine in the amount of $350.00 PLUS ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges. PAYMENT OF $50.00 DUE ON DECEMBER 1ST, 2022. Defendant to pay $50.00 each month by the 1st of the month until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carlo P Quesada

records.addlTxt: See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP.

Defendant Carlo P Quesada in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Carlo P Quesada.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/ Elements of the Offense.

AS TO COUNT 1 

PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:

-Pay fine in the amount of $350.00 PLUS ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges. PAYMENT OF $50.00 DUE ON DECEMBER 1ST, 2022. Defendant to pay $50.00 each month by the 1st of the month until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 4:00pm on OCTOBER 10TH, 2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.

APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 29th, 2022.

Defendant Carlo P Quesada in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Carlo P Quesada.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. 
Case adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Carlo P Quesada in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Carlo P Quesada appeared by video means with Attorney.
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 06-17-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Best Buy, 4610 S. 76th St., Greenfield, WI.

Defendant Carlo P Quesada in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6/15/2022 @1:30p
